ruleset.name: Design Rules
ruleset.description: The Code Size Ruleset contains a collection of rules that find software design related problems.

rule.name: ExitExpression
rule.description: An exit-expression within regular code is untestable and therefore it should be avoided. Consider to move the exit-expression into some kind of startup script where an error/exception code is returned to the calling environment.

rule.name: EvalExpression
rule.description: An eval-expression is untestable, a security risk and bad practice. Therefore it should be avoided. Consider to replace the eval-expression with regular code.

rule.name: GotoStatement
rule.description: Goto makes code harder to read and it is nearly impossible to understand the control flow of an application that uses this language construct. Therefore it should be avoided. Consider to replace Goto with regular control structures and separate methods/function, which are easier to read.

rule.name: NumberOfChildren
rule.message: The {0} {1} has {2} children. Consider to rebalance this class hierarchy to keep number of children under {3}.
rule.description: A class with an excessive number of children is an indicator for an unbalanced class hierarchy. You should consider to refactor this class hierarchy.

property.name: minimum
property.description: Maximum number of acceptable child classes.

rule.name: DepthOfInheritance
rule.message: The {0} {1} has {2} parents. Consider to reduce the depth of this class hierarchy to under {3}.
rule.description: A class with many parents is an indicator for an unbalanced and wrong class hierarchy. You should consider to refactor this class hierarchy.

property.name: minimum
property.description: Maximum number of acceptable parent classes.

rule.name: CouplingBetweenObjects
rule.message: The class {0} has a coupling between objects value of {1}. Consider to reduce the number of dependencies under {2}.
rule.description: A class with to many dependencies has negative impacts on several quality aspects of a class. This includes quality criterias like stability, maintainability and understandability
